div.script: document.title = $.htmlDecode('Lafourche Parish President Modifies Closure Time for Restaurants | Press Releases | Lafourche Parish, LA'); document.itemTitle = $.htmlDecode('Lafourche Parish President Modifies Closure Time for Restaurants');
div.h2: Lafourche Parish President Modifies Closure Time for Restaurants

div.p: Lafourche Parish President Archie Chaisson announced April 3rd, 2020, and later signed an Executive Order, supporting further restrictions for non-essential and essential businesses to slow the spread of COVID-19 across Lafourche Parish. These restrictions primarily affected the hours of operation for businesses which were set from 6 a.m. to 7 p.m.

“As we have said all along, the COVID-19 pandemic continues to be a fluid situation. As we work with our partner agencies, we continue to refine the data regarding the number of cases, which gives us an accurate representation of how this virus is affecting our community,” explained President Chaisson.

“With that said, beginning Wednesday, April 15, 2020, I am modifying the closure time for restaurants from 7 p.m. to 10 p.m. Although not a huge change, this will allow residents who may work past 7 p.m. to have access to these businesses; as well as, give added time for these businesses to sell their products,” said President Chaisson.
All other restrictions put into place remain in effect:

ol.li: All Non-Essential business, as defined by CISA, shall close.

All businesses in Lafourche Parish shall have their hours of operation be 6 a.m. to 7 p.m. Exceptions will be 24hr drive thru pharmacies (drive thru only), truck stops, and restaurants. Truck stops shall close the front convenience store portion of their business leaving the rear entrance open for truckers only. Restaurants can now operate from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m.

Grocery stores, pharmacies and big box stores shall have the number of people limited to 50% of the stated Fire Marshal capacity and close their lawn and garden center if applicable. Stores shall be responsible for providing a person to enforce the number of persons allowed to assure the six foot social distancing requirements.
Mechanic shops, tire shops, auto parts stores and lumber/hardware stores will be allowed to remain open but shall have their hours limited as with other businesses.
The State Fire Marshal has issued a burn ban.All residents shall not burn any solid waste, including tree debris, until the burn ban is lifted.
